area.key: Translation via OpenAI can be complex and require changes to configuration to work for you. please test before sending lots of text. You may incur API costs while using this connector.
In order to use the OpenAi Translation API, you will need to supply an API Key - this key is then used to translate using your OpenAi account.
OpenAi Model to use to translation
Number of milliseconds to wait between calls (To Avoid API Throttling)
Split any HTML before sending to translation
Make sure html elments are marked as html when sent to translation

The OpenAi connector allows you to use OpenAi for text translation

You will require an account on OpenAi, and an OpenAi Api key before you can use this service

System prompt

For the current models (e.g GPT-4) the connector will start with the following system prompt 

%1%

and then send the translation text as a user request.

'base' or 'legacy' prompt

For 'base' or legacy' models the connector will send the following prompt to the api:

%0%

The exact number of tokens, and usage will be determained be the OpenApi settings you are using to perform the translation.
Control the fine detail of the Ai request

Tweak the options being sent to the OpenAi request.

These values are the internal OpenAi Compleation Options. see the OpenAi documentation for more information.
The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.
sitive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far
Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far
Control the promt sent to Open AI for translation
Choose which API Library to use when sending translations
